pain_points_original.title: Data Security & Regulatory Compliance Risk
pain_points_original.description: The buyer must ensure any AI solution complies with strict government ICT, security, and privacy policies (IPPs) to safeguard sensitive government data and avoid breaches.

pain_points_original.title: Integration with Legacy Systems & Scalability
pain_points_original.description: The buyer is concerned about the technical challenge and cost of integrating new AI tools with their existing systems, and whether the solutions are mature and can scale effectively across government.

pain_points_original.title: Budget Uncertainty and Future Costing
pain_points_original.description: The buyer lacks clear cost models for AI solutions, making it difficult to plan budgets and allocate funds. They need indicative pricing to build a business case for future procurement.

pain_points_original.title: Need for Proven Government Use Cases
pain_points_original.description: The buyer is risk-averse and requires evidence of successful AI deployments in similar public sector environments to validate solution reliability, performance, and vendor experience before committing.

pain_points_original.title: Navigating the Complex AI Market
pain_points_original.description: The buyer lacks a clear understanding of the current AI market landscape, making it difficult to identify suitable, innovative, and mature solutions that genuinely address government needs.
